quotes: Salim acknowledges that Babu, whom he had met in 1958, played an important role in educating the people, and especially young leaders like Salim, about national and international affairs.
Together with Rajab Saleh, a Zanzibari journalist and member of the ASP , Salim went to Indonesia to attend an Afro-Asian journalists’ conference in 1963.
The leftist faction, including Babu and Issa, walked out of the ZNP in early 1963 when conservative forces in the party would not agree to the need for broader representation of all Zanzibaris.

quotes: Upon arrival in Zanzibar, however, he found that the British colonial authorities had imprisoned Babu, then the ZNP’s general secretary.

to go to Cuba, where the ZNP opened a Zanzibar office in Havana.
There Salim witnessed the impact of the Cuban Revolution in the removal of external domination and establishment of a society where black and white people enjoyed equal rights and opportunities.
where the ZNP opened a Zanzibar office in Havana.
After almost a year in Cuba, Salim returned to Zanzibar, where he was expected to stay for a week or two before returning to Havana.

Together with Rajab Saleh, a Zanzibari journalist and member of the ASP , Salim went to Indonesia to attend an Afro-Asian journalists’ conference in 1963.
After the conference he travelled to China, where he briefly met Zhou Enlai, China’s premier, and other national leaders.
